helpitem.title: ME3Tweaks Discord
helpitem.tooltip: Chat server for quick support with ME3Tweaks products and services

helpitem.title: Multiplayer Discord
helpitem.tooltip: Chat server for finding other players of Mass Effect 3 MP and Mass Effect Andromeda MP

helpitem.title: ME3Tweaks Mod Manager is a work in progress

helpmenu.helpitem: ME3Tweaks Mod Manager is currently in a preview stage. Many features from Mass Effect 3 Mod Manager are being ported over but this procedure will take some time. Please report any crashes to the ME3Tweaks Discord.

helpitem.title: NexusMods
helpitem.tooltip: Browse mods developed for Mass Effect 3 on NexusMods

list.title: How to
list.helpitem:
To add a mod to Mod Manager, drag and drop its zip/rar/7z file onto Mod Manager's main interface.

To download and add a ModMaker mod enter its code into the Mod Management > Download ME3Tweaks ModMaker Mod window.
To remove a mod, delete its folder from the mods/ directory or select it and go to the Mod Utils menu and select Delete mod.

Select a mod on the left and click Apply Mod. The mod will install. Press Start Game to start the game.

To restore your game go to Restore and choose the appropriate options (use the unpacked options if you have unpacked your DLC).

You can remove DLC mods via the Custom DLC Manager item in the Restore Menu. To remove multiplayer or integrated mods, you'll need to restore your game files either via SFAR or restoring unpacked files, as well as the basegame. You can see what's been modified by using Custom Restore. If you have no idea what this means, just restore all of your SFARs and the basegame.

If you find issues in Mod Manager, you can report them to me on my Discord. You can find a link at the top of the help menu. Please include a log from the help menu's Generate Diagnostic M3Log. I only support official installations of Mass Effect 3.

list.title: Commonly Asked Questions
list.helpitem: For most DLC mods, installation order will not matter as the load order is controller by a file in the DLC named Mount.dlc. A few Mod Manager mods can automatically reconfigure based on what is installed, so you should typically install them at the end of your DLC mods. Texture mods should always be installed at the end. If you are installing ALOT, you should install that at the end, followed by the addon, and then other texture mods you want to use. Do not install other DLC or full-file replacement mods after installation or you will break the game.

helpitem.title: Can I get banned for using mods

list.helpitem: Technically you can with Multiplayer mods. However BioWare has no active staff to do so and they haven't banned anyone since early 2013. That doesn't mean you should run mega-million, 1 hit kill, or masochist mods in public lobbies. If you must run mods that are likely to be unpleasant to others (such as ruining a legitimate MP career with mega million credits) please keep it in a private lobby.

After installing a mod, if you get a screen similar to the one below at the main menu, the DLC listed will not load.
The list may be blank if the developer did not give their DLC a name.
Installing any mods through Mod Manager should resolve this issue, unless the DLC is corrupt. Otherwise you will need to install Binkw32 bypass from the Tools menu.

helpitem.title: Restored game files but a DLC is still not authorizing

list.helpitem: If a mod you installed has Custom DLC, some options in Mod Manager do not remove them. If you attempted to restore your game but still get issues with authorizing a DLC you can go to Restore > Remove All Custom DLC and it will delete any non-standard DLC folders. If this still doesn't work you may need to repair your game from Origin.

helpitem.title: Mod Manager 5.1 Beta 5 (Build 86)**
helpitem.tooltip: This build was withdrawn after reports of JNI startup errors on update.
